intro: Cuphea excoriata, commonly known as the scarlet cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its striking red or orange tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb with upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are pollinated by birds, particularly hummingbirds, due to their shape and nectar-rich structure. Cuphea excoriata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
